website_summaries.verdict: Radiator has extra depth to yield additional surface area to enhance the cooling process.
pros: Generates less noise than previous versions of these liquid CPU coolers
Radiator has a depth of 49 millimeters, which is thicker than average for better cooling efficiency
Compatible with many different Intel and AMD sockets
Fan airflow of 77 CFM is well above average
cons: Build quality of the individual pieces could be more consistent

customer_reviews.title: Better than standard cooling.
customer_reviews.text: Before installing this water-cooling unit, my AMD Ryzen 2600X (oc 4ghz) had an individual core temperature of 96C+ when under a full load. Now I'm running 73C max. Idle drops into the 30C range. You'll definitely want to enter your BIOS and modify how fast the air intake fan runs based on your CPU temps. Test how hot your CPU gets (not your CPU core temperatures), and set your fan to run at 100% power when your CPU reaches that temperature. For example, my processor roughly tops out at 55C, so I set my fan to run at 100% power when it reaches that point to keep my core temperatures down by an extra few Celsius.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H.

customer_reviews.title: does a good job in my daughter's rig
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, does a good job in my daughter's rig. Cooling an older i5-4670. Idles at 27c, load hasn't gone above 46c. Buld is in a Cooler Master Elite 130 SFFcase, along with 8GB HyperX Fury 1600MHz, Gigabyte GTX 970, corsair RM650x PSU, Asrock H81 mobo. I call it the Black Mamba
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Hall

customer_reviews.title: They Keep Breaking Down
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say this because it has great reviews but I have had 2 of these fail on me now. I start getting this loud clicking noise and once this happens the cooling starts to get worse. The first one I exchanged with Corsair, support was great, but the replacement is now doing the same thing. I am going to have to look for another solution at this point, I don't want to keep having to rip and replace cooling systems.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lipor

customer_reviews.title: Cools very well on a non OC i7-9700k
customer_reviews.text: Currently cooling an I7-9700K inside a Silverstone SG13 case. I have added an additional fan to the front of the radiator and only to add some color led's. On its own this AIO cooler is great and I see buying another one in a future build. Fan is loud at full speed but it only runs at that speed when I am gaming and at that time either have a headset on or the speaker are blasting, and I don't even notice the fan considering the PC is sitting less than 3 feet from my ears. Highly recommend this or any other AIO cooler from corsair. Pictures and Sound test Video included.
customer_reviews.author: Jadehawk

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed after 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well enough after a reasonable installation. For seven months at least. Then I got up one morning to find the fans at max and the CPU temp at 98c. Long story short, replacing with passive cooler and fan to get system booted to check for hardware damage. I would stay away from this product because it is unreliable and could potentially damage your system if it fails at the wrong moment. Or if it fails more spectacularly, as it has for some.
customer_reviews.author: Prolific E-Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: In 10 months the AIO became unusable due to the tubing at the radiator deteriorating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easier to install than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: The Corsair Hydro series H60 AIO is a great 120mm Liquid Cooler. I have this in my system running a i7-8086K and it does a solid job at keeping temps in line. I of course would say that if you do a ton of overclocking (I do not) then go for a 240mm to get a tad more control on extra heat. If you are like me who is totally fine running an I7 out of the box with no to minimal OC then this AIO will do just fine. The LED is nice as well. Installation was super easy and I am glad I went this route. Overall 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Galaxy Tech Review

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit a z370-a pro motherboard with a 1151 socket
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit a MSI z370-a pro motherboard with a 1151 socket Very disappointed, bracket supplied in kit did not fit a 1151 socket on a MSI mobo... No idea why when its printed all over that it supports. Purchased a different brand AIO for 1151 and it worked, shrug. The board:
customer_reviews.author: zerobane

customer_reviews.title: Works Great FOR A FEW WEEKS, THEN PUMP DIES........
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this CLC cooler like the Ebola Virus...I wrote an earlier review on how good it was, guess what, it lasted like 3 weeks and pump died. What a P.O.S.. don't waste your time installing for 60.00... Get an FSP Windale 6 and not worry about a pump at all.......Because the time it takes to install, then die, then risk damaging your PC due to pump failure, having to uninstall, re order another cooler and figure out what to do with the Corsair garbage is a complete waste of time... DON'T BUY IT.......IF YOU NEED A CLC BUY THE EVGA 120 IT'S SUPERIOR IN EVERY WAY.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaBlades

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue all of a sudden with temps reaching 120+ on my gaming machine. I knew something was wrong with the cooler. Replaced my existing water cooler, of about 5 years, with this one and it peaks at about 105 in intense gaming. Would buy again. Installation was easy, IF YOU HAVE THE RIGHT BRACKETS, for your mother board. This one was completely different than my existing one so I had to dig out the MB box to find my extra brackets. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: TWDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag when I did my most recent mini upgrade. My i7 4790k normally idled around 50° C and spiked up to high 70s low 80s C when gaming. This cooler keeps my idle temps in the low 30s to low 40s, and I spike up to high 40s to high 50s when gaming. Highly recommend! Software does suck though. No matter if the RPMs are 14 or 12000, the cooling level never seems to change. Also, make sure you watch Corsair's YouTube video on how to install as there's no easily discernable way to make sure the fans are facing the right direction.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Spud

customer_reviews.title: DEAD pump within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: pump died within 2 months, RMA support opened a ticket and left it dormant, not responding to my RMA request, consider one of their competitor's coolers, it otherwise worked well when it *was* working, if your pump fails early, corsair support will NOT help you RMA it
customer_reviews.author: tbtechwiz

customer_reviews.title: Two bad units in a row
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received did not work the first time I started my computer. The pump would not turn on. I restarted and it seemed to work afterwards. Still, I did not trust it and requested a replacement. The replacement was much worse. The pump would not start until after about 30 power cycles. Once it finally started, I was able to consistently start the pump. I can't trust the 2018 version of the H60. I wonder if the pump locks up while stored or is not used in a while. I am sending both back.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Clemente

customer_reviews.title: AIO lets go
customer_reviews.text: As my first AIO it works flawlessly, comes with recent Amd bracket and two intel brackets and a Corsair SP120 fan. It includes mounting hardware and documentation. Comes pre-applied with a tim, it is powered by SATA with pump and fan connected to cpu headers. Noticed a crack in the led portion of the pump plastic doesn’t seem to leak any coolant. I added two ML120 fans to the radiator to achieve temps in very restrictive case. Will add noctua 3000 industrials and add a map sensor😁 UPDATE: I now have this cooling a 2700x and I get in a range of 50-60 °C with a “silent” fan curve
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel E.

customer_reviews.title: Pair with the Kraken G12
customer_reviews.text: I have an OEM RTX 2080 with a blower cooler that is just terrible. I can't give my card a full load without the fan sounding like a race car so I decided to use the Kraken G12 mod with the H55. Honestly, the H55 is overpriced for a 120mm radiator but I will pay it for the compatibility it provides with the Kraken G12. If you're looking to cool your CPU with an AIO, don't bother with anything smaller than a 240mm. Just go air at point. I have the radiator as a front intake in push/pull configuration and my 2080 doesn't go past 50c. Loving it
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Only comes with one type of mounting hardware for AMD
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough pre-filled water cooler. Comes w 1 cooling fan. The AMD mounting hardware assume you have the "around the cpu" style topside 2 prong mounting bracket already. If you do not have that, you have to buy one for another $10. Coolers claiming Amd compatibility usually come with the "4 through holes, forming and elongated rectangle" style mounting bracket for socket am3+, so one less start because of that. Ordered the bracket, but meanwhile I lost my patience and put on an air cooler I had laying around, and that works well enough...so now I probably will not bother taking it apart again to install the water cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Coder

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUYING CORSAIR AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: This water cooler is a little over 2 years old ..Today my PC shutdown and would not restart for more than 4 seconds...I new immediately that the CPU was overheating after I opened the case and saw that all the fluid in the cooler had leaked out... Im very lucky it didn't ruin the rest of my components !! I also recently replaced my M65 mouse that had the left click issue (well documented) with another brand that has been flawless ...CORSAIR reliability has gone to S**T....Il never buy Corsair again...It used to be great but obviously theyre QC and reliability has gone to hell ...AVOID Corsair !!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Tillery

customer_reviews.title: **WARRNING** Check of a burning smell before installing.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this and installed it on my gpu using a g12 bracket a week ago. Everything seemed to be working fine but then I started noticing a kind of chemical burning smell coming from within my case. So I checked all fans, wires and other components. Just could not pin point where the smell was coming from until I put my nose to the aio fins. The smell was so strong that I haven't used my computer for five days now because of the terrible odor. I want to say that I just received a bad draw but I will return this product and buy it one more time in hopes that the smell doesn't appear again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for a Silverstone mini ITX build
customer_reviews.text: You know Silverstone cases; innovative borderline eccentric design. I had the first iteration of the h60 but it failed after 3 years. No probs. Decent mileage. This one is better designed with thinner hoses and a separate power cable. I was too lazy to dig up my arctic silver and after cleaning the CPU I used the stock thermal paste (I know right, my laziness knows no bounds). Temperatures are 30-35 idle and don't go past 60 after a few hours of Monster hunter world. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: ICE COLD and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe the temps after installing this! Honestly, I expected it to be a bit lower quality since it's their cheapest model that was available at the time I purchased it... But Corsair came through again! It keeps my cheap i5-9400F at 26C while overclocking it from 2.9 to 4.1. I couldn't be happier. Under 100% CPU usage it's gotten no warmer than 56C. I wouldn't have expected this from a cheap 1 fan cooler, yet here we are with no regrets and full of love for it. In the future, I will be recommending Corsair and using it on the next build at the end of 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Toko

customer_reviews.title: Cooler in function, form, and all the way that counts
customer_reviews.text: There was a power surge, as luck would have before my APS arrived. Multiple surges and blackouts last month on Long Island, affecting my nephew's laptop & my workstation toasting one of my external drives and somehow my liquid H2O Antec cooler - the bios, board testing, and lastly the cooler's fan rattling wrecked havoc. Enter the dogs of war from Corair. It was bloody quiet, lighting easy installation saving my bacon from being too crisp. Seriously, for the performance/build quality/stellar support reputation/looks and price. You will never find a better combination. That's my 2 cent unsolicited testimonial.
customer_reviews.author: Exotic Spaces

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is very good quality, and for the price, the performance is good. It isn't the strongest performing cooler I've seen, but for the price, it is good value. My rating is based on how good the build quality is. The cooler is pindrop silent, even at high RPM. In addition, the online youtube guides recommend you to install this cooler in a pull configuration, whereas the instructions included recommend a push configuration. It's quite confusing. Strongly suggest you follow exactly what the instructions in the booklet state - to do a push configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Quality and performance going the wrong way
customer_reviews.text: Having to fish a SATA cable on an existing system to the back not good. Pump running at 4700 RPM? Massively noisy from vibration. Runs 3 degrees "C" warmer at idle than a $59 CM budget cooler. Looks good through the window, but quality did not seem as good as previous generation. I really liked the one cable to the fan header solution on the previous generation also. I'd propose some product improvements. Slower pump, one connector cable to fan header, subtle LED off the fan header power, and better cooling. Sorry Corsair - I'm a fan, but not of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler works wonders on my AMD 1100T but it was a pain to get bolted into my case. Also once I did the board I was using didn't recognize that I had installed a cpu fan and still does not to this day. At first this did not let me start the system but after switching the pump and fan connections it now works after a prompt asking if I want to start despite a lack of a fan which I know is in actuality there.
customer_reviews.author: nattiebumpo

customer_reviews.title: This thing has never worked right.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for years and it's never cooled very well. Because of that it's been relegated to back up PC's. I tried putting it on my Ryzen 3600x with the adapter and couldn't get it to work right. Moved it to my office back up PC with an I7 6700k, keeps it cool for gaming but putting any stress on the cpu and it bumps up to 84c, with pump and fans at performance. My experience with corsair "customer service" has been horrible so not going to bother with trying for warranty help. I'll just replace it with a much cheaper Cooler Master.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Jo

customer_reviews.title: A good AIO for an ITX system.
customer_reviews.text: Installed (using the intended push-pull configuration) this in a lian li tu150 for my Ryzen 7 3700x it on the extreme fan and pump settings it keeps my cpu running between 52 and 68 degrees celcius with little issue some spikes to 74-76c. The water temps get to 47c which is a bit high for my liking but from what I read so long as water stays under 60c it's safe. For a 120mm aio with a thick radiator I cannot complain. Perhaps a Noctua NH U12S would be better as its air and designed to soak all the heat. But as it is holding up I cannot complain it works.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer Too Cheap to Include an AM4 Bracket or This is Old Stock
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't use it. Attempted to build a mini ITX machine exclusively for autodesk, this cooler had no AM4 Bracket. Hah. I am pretty sure the last 5 of these I have bought had a whole bag of spare hardware with them. That said, for 100 greenbacks and the "AM4 COMPATIBLE" sticker on the box, just like the one I saw at the store - I expected AM4 support, it wasn't here when I went to build. Lost points with me, that was the ease factor of an AIO going out the window - and that is really all an AIO is good for - ease.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: AMD cpu users pay MORE to use this cooler...for no reason.
customer_reviews.text: This description bullet, for this cooler: "AM4 bracket not included. Please visit the Ryzen page on the Corsair website to order a free AM4 retention bracket " Unfortunately, Corsair denies that this product gets a "free" bracket. In fact, it will cost the consumer $15 to get what should be included in the box. My calls to them about the erroneous reference at Amazon has yet to yield any change in the bullet description. Corsair OWNS the description, not Amazon. I know this cooler works, but Corsair's failure to act has driven me away...forever. The cooler has been returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Corsair support is a joke, their products are over-rated garbage
customer_reviews.text: Everything I've bought from corsair has broken or stopped working within a year, and none of it was covered by any sort of warrantee. This peice of crap doesn't fit in any case I have, nor my friends cases. Now the pump stopped working randomly.,.. and SURPRISE!! Corsair says they won't help me fix it or repleace it. Can't believe I used to sell so much of this crap to people. You'll be much happier with something like Logitech. I know I will. I am NEVER buying corsair crap again, not will I recommend it to my clients. Complete garbage with 0 support.
customer_reviews.author: Orion Nash

customer_reviews.title: A tight fit but a nice unit
customer_reviews.text: The tubes are rather stiff. It make it difficult to route them in small cases. If you get creative in your ITX step-by-step order, you can make this work. I’ve been using Corsair AIOs since the original H100. Cools my i9-9900k provided I don’t try to go super OC’d. More an issue of small case. These CPUs get toasty, but my machine runs quiet enough for bedroom use. Upgrade the fans to Corsair ML120 fans however if you want quiet performance with a side of RGB.
customer_reviews.author: The4thAggie

customer_reviews.title: Great for old X79 boards
customer_reviews.text: I always exhausted the fans out of the case but the instructions said to have the airflow inside of the case, works much better even though I have 5-6 other fans in the case. Don't forget that snap ring to hold the bottom of the clamp on the cpu mounting bracket, look at the pics makes it much easier,instructions included. The thermal compound that came with it I just left on, works well. Go slow, take your time and whatever you do do not forget to plug in the cpu fan control to the motherboard,Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Just Google the name of the item and see how many times this thing is shipped defective and has to be RMA'd. It's absolute trash. I'll never buy another Corsair product again and I've bought peripherals and cases from them. I had to troubleshoot this thing from initial ownership realizing it is ultimately defective. No need to risk it yourself when you need cool temps or are overclocking your expensive hardware. Toss this thing out of the running and spend a few extra bucks on something different and more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: K Uni

customer_reviews.title: dead after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for My gaming ITX build using the Ryzen 2600x. The AM4 bracket was included in the box. keeps the CPU cool enough to get great all core boosts Edit: 4/10/19 Pump died after 2 months.I changed rating to reflect the failure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these when I first built the machine that lasted 5 years. It finally gave out. Bought a new one to replace it on June 11. Today I noticed it leaking. Amazon will not replace and Corsair wants 7-10 days to replace and I have to jump through hoops to replace it. Stay far far away!!!
customer_reviews.author: brad yazell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install after a couple of Mods
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for as my original ECO water cooler system pump stopped working and finding a single fan radiator for a AM3+ CPU system is getting hard to find. This one bolted right on where my other one was at, I had to mod a couple of things so I could just bolt it on. I used my fan from the ECO because how the H55 fan was going to bolt on to my case was no what I wanted, everything went on like clock work. keeps idle temps at 50F degrees and loads when at 100% on all 6 cores at 114F Degrees, working great.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: These units are notorious for having pump failure. Ordered 2 brand new H60 AIO and both came with broken pump. When the AM4 mount is tightened with screw key, it is bending the block/motor thus causing it to fail. I would not recommend this AIO. Even if it works in the beginning, it is likely to fail destroying your other components. This almost fried my brand new 3700X by reaching over 100C. Went with NZXT M22 and cannot be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin A.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Performer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Corsair Hydro series I've used in a personal installation. The first was a different model for a rig I built in 2010 and it's still going strong. This installation replaced the Wraith Cooler heatsink that was packaged with my AMD FX 8370. There is obviously going to be a difference between air and liquid cooling, but I dropped 15-20 degrees Celsius at any given processor load over the Wraith Cooler. I haven't overclocked with this rig and don't plan to, so I can't speak for that. In any case I don't think anyone can go wrong with these AIO closed-loop units from Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stranathan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it unless you have an Intel CPU
customer_reviews.text: I received this item and was unable to remove the Intel backplate that comes preinstalled for some reason. A technical representative advised that this is a common problem with this item and yet it still ships with the Intel backplate. It is absurd to preinstall the backplate for shipment. My frustration could have been completely avoided if no backplate were preinstalled because I then could have just installed the AMD backplate without having to remove the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8700K inside a coolermaster elite 130 case, there is no room. Temps playing BF5 were peak 61Cwhich is a major drop from an air cool which was pushing 85C. Well worth it in my tiny case! With the pump outlets being on the side, it allows for it to be more flexible and fit around everything versus the H80i which the hoses come out of the pump and hit the power supply in the Elite130. Idle temps are 24-30C depending on ambient temperature!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Piper

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with all required parts, RMAed it and then mounting bracket snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've heard this is a great product. Unfortunately, mine came without all the required parts, and Corsair was unable to send me the missing part without RMAing the entire thing. The whole process has been super-slow. Next time, I'll return through Amazon. Corsair's customer service is to be avoided. Now, I've finally received the RMA, and the AMD mounting bracket snapped in half on its own post-install. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel White

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet. Keeps my Ryzen 7 2700x about as cool as the wraith prism cooler that it came with. Around 40c idle and in the mid 70s under load. I wouldn't use this if you plan on overclocking. It just doesn't have the poop that a 240mm AIO would have. Installation was fairly simple, no English AMD instructions but the pics are all you really need if you are lost. It came with all you would need for any current Intel or AMD CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Computer runs like a 2020
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't expect much switching from fan to liquid but the difference is night and day. If you plan on playing ultra settings in triple A titles then I highly suggest getting a liquid cooler. This cooler upped my fps by 10-15. My games were very sluggish. They were dipping into teens on frames and it would become almost unplayable. My system is a bit older and I'm getting 40 to 50 fps on ghost recon wildlands while on ultra. I'm pretty happy with that considering I was around 15 to 25. Gave new life to computer 😁
customer_reviews.author: Gmac

customer_reviews.title: Regular pump failures.
customer_reviews.text: I have a history with corsair, and unfortunately as of late that history has been bad. These All in one coolers fail constantly. I've had 3 h100i v2s, and now the h80i fail due to whatever cheap pump they use. Then when they do fail, good luck fighting with Corsair. Stay far away from this company. Their ram is OK, cases are good, but never ever buy one of their AIO systems. Worst customer support I've ever dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: Totaleklypse

customer_reviews.title: Great with Kraken G12 Bracket and Rx580
customer_reviews.text: Using this to cool my sapphire pulse rx580 and used the NZXT Kraken g12 bracket. temps went from 34c idle to 24 idle, 65c to 45c under load. Gta5 on all maxed settings never goes above 45c using push pull front mounted for the radiator
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: They just don't last! Purchase September 14, 2014
customer_reviews.text: They just don't last replaced twice. Purchase September 14, 2014. Missed warranty deadline by one week. Used for graphics cooling and the pump went out again. Saw the temp's going up over the last few months and should have sent in a RMA, but it's just such a big breakdown. I have moved to more traditional cooling just easier if something goes bad. This is the 4th pump to go down. That's is not a good sign!
customer_reviews.author: California Academy Of Health

customer_reviews.title: Used H60 in Alienware R8.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is I used this for the CPU if you don't have liquid cooling AND I used the Consair ML120mm Pro fans for the H60 and for the Front Fan. Temps dropped by more than 10% stable and the PC is sooooo quiet now and nothing compared to the original fans when ramped up. Got a R8? This is a big improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Rex Anthony Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: The installation was pretty forward. I used it on an AMD cpu. It was a replacement for an Enermax liquid cooler thatdied. The only thing you have to watch out for is that the AMD mounting configuration is designed to work with stock cpu cooler mounting base. Unfortunately I had lost part after I installed the Enermax cooler. Luckily I was able to Enermax base with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery C

customer_reviews.title: Picked up one if these to pair with a Corsair ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked up one if these to pair with a Corsair H55 Silent to replace the stock blower on an ASUS GTX 1070 Turbo. Installation time including very careful removal of the stock blower was probably about an hour. For the 1070/1080 use the "C" positions. Using the aforementioned combo with the radiator attached to a Rosewill 120mm fan that was already in my case keeps the 1070 under 52C under 100% load at 2124MHz boost clock and ~9300MHz memory clock. Idle temperature has dropped from the low to mid 40s to 30c. Only wish this cooler had about another inch of hose, hence the docked star.
customer_reviews.author: krisp

customer_reviews.title: Space
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. As other reviews have said check your computer case as well as where everything is before you purchase this cooler, this thing is massive and the tubes are stiff (which is a good thing, you don't want flimsy bendable tubes). On my computer case I tried setting it up on the top back but the radiator was too bulky for it to fit, I had enough space in my case only AFTER I took out a bracket that I was never going to use. WORD OF WARNING!!!!!!! CHECK YOUR COMPUTER CASE FOR SPACE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: thewildtwo

customer_reviews.title: Great option for first time liquid cooling users!
customer_reviews.text: This a fantastic option for liquid cooling. Especially if you don't have a lot of experience with it. Build quality is excellent, it's easy to install, it's quiet, and it works like a charm. The only thing I will say, is that the placement of the radiator can be tricky if you aren't using a high end, name brand case. If you went with a less expensive option, you may have to get creative.
customer_reviews.author: Big Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good AIO for a mid tower case that can't fit 240/280 radiators.
customer_reviews.text: Noticed my Swiftech AIO was failing due to erosion and needed to replace it with something small enough to fit inside my Rosewill Blackhawk mid tower case and keep an i7 990X cool. This does the job. Nothing looks particularly great inside that case, but it fits, and that's what matters. I have used a larger version of Corsair's AIO water cooling, and they're pretty good, but nothing beats a real custom loop. radiators.
customer_reviews.author: ZapixTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and  just use the stock Heatsink/Fan
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy another Corsair AIO. I have this one that was fine for a couple of months but started running hotter than the stock AMD Heatsink. I contacted Corsair but their tech support said a stock Ryzen 3700X temp exceeding 75C was normal temperature for my CPU. They offered no recommendations or help in any way. I removed it and threw it away. WASTED MONEY! I am a system builder that used to recommend Corsair, but this experience changed that.
customer_reviews.author: Kickstand

customer_reviews.title: My Octa-core CPU Never Overheats
customer_reviews.text: Like, it's never even warm. This was a good buy. Install it how you see fit, but definitely use the program it comes with to customize the fan and pump settings. Definitely a worthy buy. Also, don't forget to plug in the USB cable for it. Yeah I'm talking to you Steve, remove that card reader... You know you don't use it. Sure it's got an extra USB port on it, but NO!! It's not worth it. I digress. Buy this if you need a good cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Andre L Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Proper thermal pasting
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is amazing, I have one for my CPU & GPU. It has cut my temps in half on my GPU and 10 Celsius on my CPU. I have an Alienware Area 51 r5 and it only has 120 mm fan mounts. It can with a good cooler but I wanted a bigger better cooler. Well this was the one, double the thickness radiator with push pull configuration. If you don't have a lot of room in you case for a 240 mm, this is just as good. There are also slimmer fans available from other manufacturers if it is to thick for your case with the supplied fans.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney D.

customer_reviews.title: was working (kinda)
customer_reviews.text: Was working when i first got it. now all it does is run my CPU at about 55-68 degrees even at idle. when i am just watching YouTube. Tried multiple positions and configurations. doesn't cool well at first and now it just does it job without much effort. No help from Corsair and Amazon had someone on it, but they never got back to me, anyways gotta buy another cooler and might not be corsair this time. probably is a must effort.
customer_reviews.author: K. Demouchet

customer_reviews.title: Worse than an air cooler
customer_reviews.text: This AIO is very loud at full fans. The USB header on the CPU block is at 6 o'clock making cable management hard. On my 9700k i got better temps from the Dark Rock 4 (not to mention the silent operation).
customer_reviews.author: k1ba

customer_reviews.title: I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the AM4 retention bracket (CW-8960046) to mount it on my AM4 motherboard but the bracket does not fasten to this cooler at all. So I have no idea if it's any good or not. (EDIT) Ok, been doing some research and this is the 2018 version of the H75. This one WILL NOT WORK with the CW-8960046 retention bracket but the H75 that came before the 2018 version will.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: " Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after upgrading from a AMD A10-7700k to a Athlon X4 880k, the low-profile Noctuna heatsink I was using in my wife's mini-ITX build was overwhelmed in seconds leading to shutdown. This was the only way to get high-end cooling in the space available. Performs as well as well as the much larger NZXT Kraken x60 I use in my mid-tower desktop and is whisper quite. My wife is shocked at the noise difference. her comment was, "It's going to sneak up and kill me." Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K Cable II

customer_reviews.title: Great for Intel, think twice about AMD chips
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a i7 3770k in 2014! It has been a trooper since then. Temps always in the low 30s degree C. Recently, I fried most of my system and decided on an AMD Ryzen 3600X. I installed this cooler and the temperatures were 50C idle-ing. After a bit of research, I noticed the h50 cooler has a slight convex design to match intel heat-spreaders which are non-flat! So, I placed a 1000 grit sandpaper on a flat surface and ground the copper flat for the ryzen chip. No I get 29C temps at idle. I am not sure if the heatsink/pump is still convex in design.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my air cooler mount broke inside my system. I was able to install it in about 30 minutes and my system has been running beautifully ever since. If there is any noise from the coolers fan, I cant hear it. I would highly recommend this unit to replace nearly any air cooling system. Its probably not the most optimal solution for extreme overclocking but it is a great product nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Soper

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a Kraken G12 GFX LC conversion
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Corsair AIO 'fan' and prefer their AIO's over others since I've never had a problem with them. This unit was purchased specifically for and with use of the Kraken G12 water cooling conversion bracket for GTX 10XX cards. While this cooler is not compatible with the G12 as it comes, I did some minor smoothing of the plastic housing around the copper plate to make it compatible. For my use, it is cooling my GFX extremely well. Would recommend for CPU's too if you're not into extreme overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: TickleSlip

customer_reviews.title: Corsair makes good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It did not work for my build but that's because I'm doing something pretty custom for normal builds this unit would be great. I needed longer tubes and hoses coming off the side of the pump rather than out the top to meet me needs. I'm installing a second mini itx system in the bottom of my Phanteks Enthoo 719 case if anyone was curious to my use case.
customer_reviews.author: OmniPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Great AOI CPU Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a compact AOI water cooler to replace my gigantic CoolMaster air cooler. This really did the trick. It lowered my CPU temps by about 5 - 10 deg C. The biggest change was my GPU's - since they didn't have all that hot air blowing on them anymore, they dropped approximately 20 deg C under load. And RGB waterblock to boot! Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooled great the first 4-5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first 5 months, then after started cooling less and less only when running games like pubg. When running Gears of war 4, the gpu literally hits 90c, no way I can play and risk frying my gpu. Asked for a replacement by phone, and they wanted me to pay $80 (which is way more than the original price), just to have one without working while the replacement is sent back. Dont really like the way customer support is handling the RMA issue, i was going to pay for the replacement at same price previously, but wasnt going to pay $80 with or without shipping (cant remember).
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: my h80i v2 aio came with am4 hardware
customer_reviews.text: aio arrived faster than expected, although the listing says am4 bracket must be bought separately for the h80i v2 mines came with all the necessary for intel and amd sockets hardware including the am4 bracket and screws without having to order anything else
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, far superior to stock.
customer_reviews.text: The Corsair H55 keeps my i7-3770 nice and cool. Installation was easy and took about 20 minutes. The only issue was that the included three pin fan always ran on at maximum speed, so I used a four pin fan instead. I also wiped off the thermal paste that came with it and used Arctic Silver 5 instead. Idle is in the 20c range. After playing GTA V for an hour on maxed out settings, the highest temperature I saw was 36c. After running Intel Burn Test for half an hour, the highest temperature I saw was 55c. For comparison, the CPU would get as high as 90c when playing GTA V using the stock Intel cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Leisenheimer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my i5 nice and cool!
customer_reviews.text: I started with a Rosewill cooler. Lasted exactly 3 months, and the system would over heat. This cooler is predictable, quiet, and keeps my 9600KF around 120 F even at 100% old sustained. Much easier to install than the Rosewill. This cooler’s lines are easier to move and manipulate, and did just fine in my case where I don’t have a ton of room. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Climbyourarms

customer_reviews.title: works the same as a fan
customer_reviews.text: Installed it and it looks cool in the case. Really like the lights and the app to configure the lights. However it does not cool any cooler than the stock fan that came with my intel cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made but not effective
customer_reviews.text: I used this cooler to build a Hackintosh with an ASUS Z370-H motherboard and i3-8350K CPU, and it struggled mightily to keep temperatures under control. I didn't do any overclocking, and had constant temperature alarms. I returned it for a refund, and instead got a Noctua NH-D15 and it was night-and-day. I'm now overclocked, and the Noctua is handling the task with aplomb. Perhaps I got a defective unit, but I'd stay away and look at Noctua air coolers for a virtually silent and effective solution.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Cody

customer_reviews.title: H60 keeps my I5-9600K idling at 29C, and Quiet too!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a Cooler Master Elite 130 mini ITX case - perfect. Installed the radiator fan blowing in, and even in this small case packed with cables, my CPU idles at 29C, and it's quiet even when UEFI fan control is set to standard. This model installs so much easier than the H55. A back plate is installed using four stand offs, the pump is set atop the CPU and four knurled knobs hold the pump to the backplate. A little care, and even a gorilla fingered hobbyist like me can install this without bending any radiator fins. This is my second build using the H60. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: If you have a CPU over 95W TDP DO not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have an i7 8086k The fan is noisy when fully load and the temperature is around 95° I will recommend getting a 240mm AIO cooler or better air cooler like D15 If use default setting will not run AIDA64 test for longer than 10 min. The fan is terrible, noisy, cannot believe two fans fully load works like a vacuum. And still cannot control the temperature well Will return it and change to a better air cooler,
customer_reviews.author: Xinyu

customer_reviews.title: Buy nylon washers and put them on the backplate to back of the motherboard on each corner use 2-3
customer_reviews.text: Okay dont over tighten screws and it fits even in ibuypowers nzxt model case witch is medium case like nzxt s340 and buy "nylon" washers u will need them to put on the back plate bracket on each corner i had to use 3 on each 4 corner to get it to not be loose the aio cools so good even for a i7 7700k witch runs hot but this keeps it at 60 to 70 runs quiet also um install the head pump first then the radiator dont be afraid to snug it in the tubeing wont kink
customer_reviews.author: carlos barrera

customer_reviews.title: Corsair’s silent ninja!
customer_reviews.text: Install was tricky if using on AMD build due to the clamp-like screws that hold onto the STOCK AMD bracket, so don’t throw yours away if you plan on our purchasing this. I did and had to order another bracket off Amazon for $7.00, but this cooler works like a dream. Under full load on Ryzen 5 2600 oc’d @3.95 it sits at 36•c and idles around 21•c. Not to shabby in my book!
customer_reviews.author: xDaddyWolfx

customer_reviews.title: Heat problems solved
customer_reviews.text: We were having some heating issues with the wife's gaming rig (yeah, my wife has a gaming rig -- that's how charmed my life has been), so we decided to replace her original water-cooling unit with one of these since it was looking like the pump had gone bad. Installation was... well, not quite Easy-Button easy, but it was pretty doable for a guy like me who's slapped together a computer from parts a few times. What can I say? It works, and her computer's not overheating any more. That's pretty much what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Morris

customer_reviews.title: Works for LGA 1151
customer_reviews.text: This product does work for LGA 1151 MBs as advertised. Originally I thought it did not as youu can see in the picture. The mounting bolts did not match up with the MB holes. However, the bolts do SLIDE. Making this thing fit. Again I repeat they SLIDE. The mount is adjustable. I'm happy buyer and my pc is gonna look sick when I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: RadioactiveJman

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend closed-loop systems as they're easier to maintain, they allow overclocking, and they're very quiet. Fans in a computer are always the loudest component and if you can eliminate or silence them, you should. Pretty easy to install though if you're not a computer builder please get a friend who is to help. CPU's and RAM are really easy to install, CPU coolers like this can be a step more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mantek

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I had this cooler installed since october of 2014. It's been cooling a 4970k since then, always worked perfectly till about 3-4 months ago i noticed it making a water sloshing noise, must have heated and burned off some of the coolant, it still kept my cpu at 33-40c idle at the time of replacement, i upgraded to the H60 because i think it looks better, now my idle is 29-37c so the new cooler is definitely an upgrade being full of coolant lol. Cant ask for much more with a cooler to last 5 years thats good with me.
customer_reviews.author: John Fuller

customer_reviews.title: GPU Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This AIO cooler works as a perfect complement to NZXT's Kraken G12 GPU mounting bracket. This AIO keeps my GPU a sold 10 to 15 degrees cooler all across the board. It idle's anywhere from 17c to 21c and runs at 50c playing Rise of the Tomb Raider with graphics maxed out. Before using the cooler I was running around 85c. Instillation was super easy. The hardest part I had to figure out was where I wanted to mount the radiator in my case. If your GPU runs hot or you want to play with some overclocking this AIO and NZXT's bracket are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfeman

customer_reviews.title: Great for non overclockers.
customer_reviews.text: this product is greast if you want to get rid of the ugly intel cooler that comes with the cpu. it does a great job at keeping the cpu cool. i would not recommend if you have an i9 9900k or something that can overclock heavily. but you can definitely still use it on those cpus and be confident that your chip wont fry. very easy to install and looks cool when it lights up. if you want the rgb i would definitely recommend buying the h100i instead.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Palma

customer_reviews.title: Nice 120mm size AIO cooler
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on AM4. It is cooling my Ryzen 7 3700X. Not dramatic improvement over stock cooler but noise level is better and it looks cool... I added second 120mm slim fan for push/pull operation.
customer_reviews.author: Rokji

customer_reviews.title: Watercooling made easy.
customer_reviews.text: I got into watercooling nearly 20 years ago and it was an adventure. With this type of setup it is super easy. I am using this to cool a big old AMD 8350. It really helped get the temps down and made the system very quiet. Pretty happy. I bought it with plans to use it on my next CPU as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud81918

customer_reviews.title: Best solution for overclocking in tight spaces!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the H80i v2, my temperatures dropped drastically in my case. I was running a Cooler Master Hyper 212evo before this, and it was a nice cooler. Now that I am overclocking my i5-4670k, I needed something to cool my CPU better. With my 212evo my system idled at 40c and under load got to around 70c. No problems at all installing the H80i v2, very simple and user friendly. As soon as I installed the liquid cooler, my CPU idles at around 25-30c and under load I have not seen it go above 45c. Very pleased with this cooler, and for a smaller case it fits wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: It lights up!
customer_reviews.text: It changes color!!! Hoses are pretty stiff, first watercooler so I was hesitant to man handle them into position but with a little devil-may-care attitude I got it secured. Mounted so it's pushing out the back (says to mount to suck from the top, but...) as it fit my case's airflow design. Perfectly cool temps, I don't have to worry about overheating or anything. For reference, if you've ever had a big Zalman mounted on your CPU, this is better.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Works well and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: For a fairly inexpensive cooler this works very well I do some light PC gaming on a very modest and frankly outdated set up however it comes with thermal paste applied to the face and it has been holding up great keep the CPU much colder than my previous unit. I'm not sure if it supposed to but I can hear the coolant circulation when I start my PC and maybe it's a quibble to some but I like actually knowing it's running so I cant complain. Instructions arent the best but it's a very straightforward install. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: best cooler I always use corsair always
customer_reviews.text: so I have installed the v1 about 10 times and doing this one was same exact thing but putting the cooler on blind from the outside makes me want to punch a wall it sucks. Other then that this is the best cooler by far. One fan showed up didn't work at all but still a great product. Ended up couldnt even use any fan that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L.

customer_reviews.title: H60i cooler does not fit well, cheap metal.
customer_reviews.text: I am using the budget case Fractal Force G and this H60i will not fit into the rear of the case. The PCI covers prevent it from fitting. Then when I mounted it to the top of the case, it pushed my Bothervoard to where I can’t plug in the display port or HDMI cables, luckily I’m using my external graphics card. But that was really annoying. The case itself is super flexible, more than it should be, the metal is super thin and flimsy. I wouldn’t buy this case if I had to do it over again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good cooling; very noisy fans
customer_reviews.text: This does a very good job cooling, 4 core CPU temp was averaging about 25 degrees while light use ... about 33 degrees with heavy 3d gaming. Quite happy. P.s. I have alienware Aurora R4 rig. Seems like a decent unit. But the fans are so noisy!! If this were quiet, I'd give 5 stars but take off 2 for being so very loud.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Shipped without thermal paste or mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this cooler for a new pc build. Saw that the reviews were decent and went for it. The item that they shipped to me came with ZERO thermal past and included no hardware to install to an actual mother board. No AMD hardware or mounting plates. It's as if they sent me a used or refurbished item. I am extremely disappointed and upset at the lack of quality control and waste of my time. I will be staying away from corsair products going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: One Time use only (h55)
customer_reviews.text: The h55 quiet edition is a good cpu cooler, however, corsair's backplate is plastic and the metal screw-holes can slip making it nearly impossible to take off (eventually I had to superglue the screws to the plastic just to free my prossesor). Additionally, the backplate uses 2 pieces of foam to put pressure on the cpu, but because they are extremely sticky, it is incredibly easy to tear the foam off. As a result, this cooler seems to be a one time use product. While both problems can be solved with some creativity, corsair should have made a stronger backplate on this product
customer_reviews.author: Fav

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Used this with a nzxt g12 bracket to liquid cool a 1070ti. This cooler did an excellent job and with the card being heavily overclocked, the high only got to 45 Celsius in 75 Fahrenheit ambient room. Had it this way for half a year now with no complaints and within that timeframe the cpu in the machine was cooler my a thermal take 240 mm aio which had its pump fail in less than 3 months while this Corsair unit is good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lerman

customer_reviews.title: 3 Units failed already
customer_reviews.text: This product is 5 star as long as it works. I bought 1 H80v1 and it failed after a year - figured out it might be a fluke or something. Bought another one, failed after a year. Gave it last chance and it failed in under a year. Unless you feel like spending $100+ every year and replacing your cooling system, avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maciej Kuciara

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't my first Corsair liquid cooler, so fairly easy to install on an AMD chip. I did not realize that the sata cord was necessary. I figured it was to power the silly light it comes with, I was very wrong. It actually powers the whole thing, older models ran off of the motherboard. One last note when did these get so expensive, I bought my last H50 for around 50 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Dj DaZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Pros: CPU runs so much cooler now. Very quiet. install was very quick, once I realized how. Can run heavy graphic games, with CPU temps averaging around 90-100F. Cons: AM3 setup was a little confusing at first, until I realized I didn't need to remove the base already on my motherboard. Instructions weren't very clear about AM3 setups. Other Thoughts: I plan on buying more of these, for my other AM3 systems, in my family. Great deal, for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James Pike

customer_reviews.title: Good I guess?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and had it for about a week. My wife threw away the box before I could repack it. It seems since I had this my CPU Temp ranges in the 50+'s but then I will get a dip in temp to the 20+'s. Which causes my FPS to drop on games causing it to lag. Then it'll jump back up to the 50+'s. Anyone got any Ideas? Could it be I need more thermal paste? I have the 2 fans facing on the back side of my case with the fan arrows on the holes facing Left and Down on both fans. Does it matter the direction?
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: Great liquid cooling works great.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy. My computer now is quieter than it has ever been after it replaced a similar Asetek that the pump failed on. My CPU temp was 32c idle and even when under load did not go over 40c. I used the thermal compound that is already on the unit for my installation. The unit overhangs the thumbscrews of the pump on my X99A gaming motherboard. I had to install the second fan after i had put the pump on the CPU. Also the tubing is very thick about 2x the diameter of my old cooler. The tubes moves into place without much issue and they stayed in place so i could put my cover on without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Cools
customer_reviews.text: This AIO works exactly as expected. I used a very similar Corsair AIO on my previous build that was done in 2012 and never had a second of trouble with it so had no problem with going with on this latest build. The only issue is installing and that is more with AMD because of how you have to 'clip' a(ny) cooler to their socket design. CPU temp on all cores runs in the 30's to lower 40's not matter what I'm doing. (Not overclocking since system is fast enough without having to introduce all that brings with it at times.)
customer_reviews.author: nodos

customer_reviews.title: Cools my Computer
customer_reviews.text: My stock cooler just wasn't cutting it anymore. My average temperature under load on my I7-4790K was nearing 85 degrees. I installed this one after removing the old heatsink and cleaning up the thermal paste with 99% isopropyl alcohol. After running a GTA5 for about 45 minutes which used to bring my CPU to almost 90 degrees, it was only topping out at 61. Needless to say I think my old PC might have another year or two left in it with this upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: The Bauman Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt cool as good as Seidon 120 it was supposed to replace.
customer_reviews.text: I have a FX9590, which is a hot processor, but my CM Seidon 120 has kept it cool for four years. Unfortunately, it has been dying, so I decided to replace it with this, given that the corsair was supposed to cool better. It doesn't. My dying seidon did a better job than this thing new. Just bought a Kraken x62 like I should have from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Tankcommander

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a very good product. I say 'seems' because I don't have any before and after temps to compare. Seems very solid and quiet. It comes with two fans for a push/pull through the radiator. You could make it one or the other just leave out one of the fans. Nice small pump. Much nicer to manipulate the installation. I had a double radiated which was a real pain to install.
customer_reviews.author: GregR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooling, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Corsair cooler. I have uced them in the 3 builds i have done and i have had no issues with them at all. The RGB is a nice touch fo no extra cost. These do have copper plates which is awesome because that makes them compatible with liquid metal thermal paste, and the combo of them has amazing performance. WITH liquid metal as opposed to the stock paste(which is really good for stock thermal paste, kudos to corsair) i got a 4-5°C difference. Great cooler, great brand. I thoroughly recommend these coolers and the bigger variants as well
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Block

product_meta.title: Corsair Hydro Series H80i v2 AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, 120mm Thick Radiator, Dual 120mm SP Series PWM Fans, Advanced RGB Lighting and Fan Software Control, Black
product_meta.description:
Pattern Name:Single| Style:H80i V2Hydro Series H80i v2 is an all-in-one liquid CPU cooler with an extra-thick 120mm radiator and dual SP120L PWM fans for cooling that's far superior to stock CPU cooling fans. Liquid cooling simply works better than air cooling, and the self-contained design of the H80i v2 makes it easy for you to protect your valuable CPU. The H80i v2 has Corsair Link built in. Just attach the included cable to a USB header on your motherboard and download the free Corsair Link software, and you can monitor CPU and coolant temperatures, adjust fan speeds, and customize the LED lighting directly from your desktop . Cooling Socket Support Intel 115x, Intel 2011/2066, AMD AM3/AM2, AMD AM4, AMD TR4 (Purchase TR4 bracket CW-8960049)
Fan Dimensions 120mm x 25mm
Fan Speed 2435 RPM
feature_bullets: Extra-thick 120mm radiator: a depth of 49mm provides more surface are for rapid cooling
Advanced SP120L PWM fan design: better high-static pressure air delivery and customizable speed

Improved cold plate and pump design: better efficiency gives you lower temperatures with less noise. Sound Blaster X-FI MB5+ALC 1220 1200b SNR HD Audio. Compatibility- Intel 115x, Intel 2011/2066, AMD AM3/AM2, AMD AM4, AMD TR4 (Purchase TR4 bracket CW-8960049)

Built-in Corsair Link: monitor CPU and coolant temperature, adjust fan speed, and customize lighting directly from your desktop.AM4 bracket not included. Please visit the Ryzen page on the Corsair website to order a free AM4 retention bracket
Fan airflow: 77 CFM. Radiator Dimensions 154mm x 123 mm x 49mm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,221 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
